newsitem.title: UK: IBM to handle ICI's IT services.
newsitem.headline: IBM to handle ICI's IT services.

text.p: Imperial Chemical Industries Plc (ICI) on Tuesday said it had agreed to outsource a major part of its information technology, voice and infrastructure services in Europe to International Business Machines Corp's IBM Ltd.

Around 11,000 telephone and 7,000 computer users inside ICI use the services -- which include telephone switchboards and computer help desks -- now to be provided by IBM. ICI has entered a four-year buy-back agreement, which it said is expected to deliver improved service within six months.

"Providing IT and telecoms services is no longer regarded as a core competence for ICI and there is an increasing reliance on external service providers with strategic planning and 'intelligent purchasing' capabilities retained in-house," said Steve Roberts, Information Systems Manager for ICI's Chemicals and Polymers business.

The agreement, which involves 124 ICI staff and contractors transferring to IBM, follows the outsourcing of major parts of ICI's telecoms networks to Racal Electronics Plc in 1994 and its mainframe computing services to Origin last year.
